dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: In captivity, male was reportedly territorial during the prespawning activities and female was usually hidden among the plant roots. Both sexes clean the underside of plant leaves. Eggs are fastened under the leaves and are also attached to roots of plants.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses

dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial
